name: Bookmarks Toolbar Fx29 Blue/Folders, Red/Bookmarks
description: Bookmark folders shown without icons in BLUE, and any bookmark not in a folder would be considered special and would be shown without icons in RED. The idea here is to use minimum real estate for Bookmarks Toolbar, so folders are used almost exclusively, and try to keep the folder names to 1-4 characters.  I know what my folders are so they don't need long names. This is the version for Firefox 29 and UP and is style 101569 (101569). The Firefox 3.6 version can be found in style 9091 (9091) ★ Recommended Companion Styles can be found in the Notes below.
additional_info:
======================== TOP OF SCROLLING AREA =================== Most of my keyword shortcuts are in a personal toolbar folder named "K" which you can see at http://www.mvps.org/dmcritchie/firefox/lessons/intro/k.html it also includes the one bookmarklet ("gg:fix") that I keep directly on the personal bookmarks toolbar and write-up can be seen at http://www.mvps.org/dmcritchie/firefox/lessons/intro/fx4_intro.htm#kws The bookmark separators cause bookmarks in each group to be sorted separately so on the bookmarks toolbar I can see a group of bookmarks in the midst of folders and the will remain undisturbed when sorting bookmarks. This is one of several styles to minimize size of toolbars.  To save more toolbar space see styles listed by my name at the top of the page (user 12592). About half of my styles are involved with making toolbars more compact AND easier to view. ★ Recommended Companion Styles for Firefox 29 and UP: style 101569 (101569) style 114776 (114766) style 42848 (42848) style 9350 (9350) style 18864 (18864) style 9349 (9349) style 115366 (115366) style 54 (54), LouCypher, you need scrollbars on menus, suggest using 650px for height style 52 (52), LouCypher, you need scrollbars on menus, suggest using 650px for height style 101570 (101570) style 9043 (9043) style 18553 (18553) style 9514 (9514), was really useful before Mozilla started destroying your older versions of Firefox by unwanted upgrades to older test versions Other places you might look for information about my Firefox use of Extensions and Styles
